cluster_classes.class_description: Components of flowering plants directly involved in sexual reproduction and pollination, including whole flowers and the pollen grains they produce and exchange.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollenâ€¦ specific reproductive material moved by butterflies among flowers.

members.entity_description: Reproductive structures of plants that provide nectar and pollen and are visited by butterflies.
Reproductive plant grains that butterflies transfer between flowers during pollination.

cluster_classes.class_description: Biological processes and organisms involved in sexual reproduction of flowering plants, including the transfer of pollen and the plants whose reproduction is enabled.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Pollination transfers pollen between flowers, enabling plant reproduction; plants are the organisms whose reproduction is assisted.

members.entity_description: Biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, enabling plant reproduction, often facilitated by animals such as butterflies.
Organisms that reproduce via flowers and benefit from pollination by butterflies.

remarks: This class has been structurally split into separate process (pollination) and organism (flowering plants) classes and may now have no direct members; consider deprecating or repurposing in a later cleanup pass.

splits.name: Pollination (Flowering Plant Process)
splits.description: The biological process in which pollen is transferred between flowers, enabling sexual reproduction in flowering plants, often facilitated by animals such as butterflies.

splits.name: Flowering Plants (Organisms)
splits.description: Organisms that reproduce via flowers and benefit from pollination, including those whose reproduction is assisted by butterflies.

args.justification: ClsC_e2aa4b5b mixes a process entity (pollination) and an organism entity (plants), so splitting into separate process and organism classes produces more coherent, single-focus classes.

ClsC_fb0a1cd7 contains reproductive structures (flowers, pollen) that are directly involved in flowering plant reproduction and pollination, matching the shared domain with related process and organism classes.
The new pollination process class is part of the same conceptual domain as plant reproductive structures and flowering plant organisms, so it should share the same Class_Group.

The new flowering plants organism class represents the organisms whose reproduction is enabled by pollination, fitting into the same overarching flowering plant reproduction & pollination Class_Group.

args.remark: This class has been structurally split into separate process (pollination) and organism (flowering plants) classes and may now have no direct members; consider deprecating or repurposing in a later cleanup pass.
args.justification: Even though its members were split out, ClsC_e2aa4b5b conceptually belongs to the same flowering plant reproduction & pollination domain and should share the Class_Group, with a remark added to flag its post-split status.
